admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
subsc: Micro- and SME finance,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Rural Finance Project
            for Vietnam was satisfactory, the sustainability was highly
            likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and Borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that the criteria
            of the participating financial institutions need to be
            periodically reviewed and adjusted to market conditions.
            More attention should be given to diversification of the
            Rural Development Fund (RDF) lending. The institutional
            development plan targets should be reviewed and updated more
            often to reflect better the new challenges and issues.
            Direct credit by crop or type of investments, at subsidized
            interest rates have not sustained economic growth. Poor
            financial conditions within participating financial
            institutions have severely constrained the projects'
            sustainability. Private financial resource mobilization is
            extremely important for the institutional sustainability.
            When interest rates either fall significantly below, or move
            well above prevailing market rates, serious implementation
            problems emerge - above market-rates have resulted in slow
            disbursements, and below-market rates have led to
            concentration of credit to relatively wealthy clients.
